qas.question: What did the Cardinal Augustin Bea's Secretariat promote?
What group condemned mixed faith marriages?
To what type of non Catholic denomination was Paul VI considered to be a great ally of?
Which church did Paul VI call "our beloved sister church"?
Who described the Anglican church as "our beloved sister Church"?

context: Cardinal Augustin Bea, the head of the Secretariat for Promoting <a0_0>Christian Unity<a0_0/>, added at the end of the visit, "Let us move forward in Christ. God wants it. Humanity is waiting for it." Unmoved by a harsh condemnation by the <a1_0>Congregation of Faith<a1_0/> on mixed marriages precisely at this time of the visit, Paul VI and Ramsey appointed a preparatory commission which was to put the common agenda into practice on such issues as mixed marriages. This resulted in a joint Malta declaration, the first joint agreement on the Creed since the Reformation. <a4_0>Paul VI<a4_0/> was a good friend of the <a2_0><a3_0>Anglican<a2_0/> Church<a3_0/>, which he described as "our beloved sister Church". This description was unique to Paul and not used by later popes.
